dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Kazakhstan, right? Like, basically the tech capital of the world now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Kazakhstan, right? Like, basically the tech capital of the world now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a result of project implementation, digital inequality level will be decreased. Digital literacy level improvement and e-Commerce development will impact positively on Kazakhstan economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, no, not exactly. Actually, they're trying to catch up in a really big way. They signed this massive $1.2 billion project in 2018.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, no, not exactly. Actually, they're trying to catch up in a really big way. They signed this massive one point two dollars billion project in twenty eighteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the official ceremony holding on October 4, 2018, the Ministry of information and communications of Republic of Kazakhstan, Transtelecom JSC, the consortium SilkNetCom LLP, and Kazakhtelecom JSC have signed the PPP agreement for the project named Providing broadband access to rural areas of the Republic of Kazakhstan using the technology of fiber-optical communication lines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: $1.2 billion? For broadband? That's, um, a lot of money for what feels like an old problem.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: one point two dollars billion? For broadband? That's, um, a lot of money for what feels like an old problem.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it’s for rural areas. Their internet access was lagging the national average by, like, 40%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's for rural areas. Their internet access was lagging the national average by, like, forty percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a result of project implementation, digital inequality level will be decreased.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: 40% worse. So, basically, no internet. And what's this gonna do, really? Make school kids suddenly geniuses?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: forty percent worse. So, basically, no internet. And what's this gonna do, really? Make school kids suddenly geniuses?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It’s supposed to improve knowledge for students, help residents get public services online, uh, vocational training too. They expect a 2% GDP boost and even a 10% unemployment reduction.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's supposed to improve knowledge for students, help residents get public services online, uh, vocational training too. They expect a two percent G D P boost and even a ten percent unemployment reduction.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Due to the Internet access rural school students will get the opportunity to improve their knowledge, and the residents will be able to receive public services online.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A 2% GDP boost? From some internet? That just sounds… optimistic. And reducing unemployment by 10 percent? How?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A two percent G D P boost? From some internet? That just sounds... optimistic. And reducing unemployment by ten percent? How?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: New IT centers, for one. They're planning 50 of them. Plus, it’s connecting 421 rural settlements and 1222 schools and hospitals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: New I T centers, for one. They're planning fifty of them. Plus, it's connecting four hundred twenty one rural settlements and twelve twenty two schools and hospitals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thus, within the framework of the project, TTC will conduct 6,000 km of fiber-optic communication wires along the railways, which will provide 421 rural settlements and 1222 local schools, hospitals, local state bodies, police stations and other institutions with the Internet access at a high speed of 20 Mbit/s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A

dialogue_turns.text: No, 20 megabits per second. Through 6,000 kilometers of fiber along railways.

dialogue_turns.text: 20 megabits. That's, uh, not exactly future-proof, is it? By the time it's all done in 13 years, that'll be slow.

dialogue_turns.text: It's a foundation, though. For future projects like smart schools, telemedicine, and safe city initiatives.
